title.narrative: Newton Fund for capacity building in data intensive science in the Middle-East

description.narrative: It is planned to start the project In Jordan and once the training programmes are established to extend it to Egypt and Turkey. The cost is £100k for 19/20 and £200k for 20/21. If the engagement in all three countries is successful then the programme can be scaled up with a budget of up to £400k in 20/21. The project will include summer schools, training workshops, staff exchanges and short term placements in companies using AI linked to the UK CDT programme. It will build on experiences from the Narit (Thailand) and DARA (South Africa) and Agritech Newton projects. The Jordan activity will be able to link to the SESAME facility where big data techniques are already being developed and there is an established Rutherford Fellowship programme.

This project will help create capacity in the application of artificial intelligence and applying big data techniques. These will be critical to enabling the partner countries to apply these advance techniques to solve development challenges in agriculture, healthcare and the environment. It is planned to start the project in Jordan and once the training programmes are established to extend it to Egypt and Turkey.
